{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3554843,"name":"Shao","username":"noctuashap","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/noctuashap/{size}/235785_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T05:35:25.178Z","cooked":"

We are experiencing an issue with our looptimes.

image2226×1634 447 KB

Our average looptimes are well below 20, but we are experiencing these occasional spikes that happen roughly in really really consistent intervals (2 secs). We suspect it’s something related to garbage collection, however using advantagescope we can see that our garbage collection time spikes with a period of 5secs, which is different.

Our code is available here:

github.com

GitHub - FRC-team5449/Prototype2025-Public

Contribute to FRC-team5449/Prototype2025-Public development by creating an account on GitHub.

Please help!

A number of the software folks on my team have been working on this issue as well. Lots of discussion on this thread that might be helpful:

Auto Init Overrun Programming
We are running into a loop overrun >1 second in auto init. The only thing being called is pathplanner buildAuto, so I am wondering if anyone has experienced a similar problem before and has a suggestion for what might be particularly inefficient about what I’m doing. Is there any way to warm up auto builder beforehand? Like calling getAutonomousCommand prior to auto init? GitHub - FIRST-Team-1699/robocats2025 here is code (dev branch)

Number 5 in this reply:

Auto Init Overrun Programming
Some things our team has done that have helped. This is mostly based on vibes instead of any real scientific testing so some of these things may not actually help. If you are using an AprilTagField layout anywhere in your code, interact with it in some way in robotInit we just set the origin to blue even though that’s the default. This class takes a super long time to “warm up” so if the first time you use it is on enable it could cause major timing issues. If you use CTRE devices, you could …

We used the implementation given here:

Auto Init Overrun Programming
Yeah sure! First we added import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Threads; public static Command threadCommand() { return Commands.sequence( Commands.waitSeconds(20), Commands.runOnce(() -> Threads.setCurrentThreadPriority(true, 10)) ).ignoringDisable(true); } into our robotContainer. This doesn’t have to be in robotContainer, but that’s where it fit best in our code. The .ignoringDisable(true) is important because otherwise the command won’t run until the rob…
